add_person module

class add_person.AddPersonForm(title: str, students: dict[str, Student], instructors: dict[str, Instructor], action_handler: ActionHandler, callback, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Labelframe

A form for adding a new student or instructor in a Tkinter GUI.

This form allows the user to input details for either a student or instructor, including a unique username, name, age, and email. The form validates the input, adds the person to the system, and updates the associated action handler.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the form, either “Add Student” or “Add Instructor”.

  • students (dict[str, Student]) – Dictionary of students, keyed by student ID.

  • instructors (dict[str, Instructor]) – Dictionary of instructors, keyed by instructor ID.

  • action_handler (ActionHandler) – Instance of the ActionHandler to manage the addition of the person.

  • callback (function) – A function to call once the person has been added successfully.

  • args – Additional positional arguments for the parent ttk.LabelFrame.

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for the parent ttk.LabelFrame.

add_action() → Student | Instructor | None[source]

Adds a new student or instructor to the system.

This method retrieves user input from the form, validates it, and adds the person to the appropriate dictionary (students or instructors) and the database via the ActionHandler.

Returns:

The added Student or Instructor object if successful, or None if validation fails.

Return type:

Optional[Student | Instructor]

validate_fields()[source]

Validates the input fields of the form.

Ensures that the username, name, age, and email fields are filled out correctly, and that the username is unique.

Returns:

An empty string if all fields are valid, or an error message string detailing the issues.

Return type:

str
